content.value: Linux systems often run critical servers and services. Without proper security, systems can be compromised, data can be stolen, and services can be disrupted. Linux security uses user privileges, firewalls, and security policies to protect the system and ensure safe operation.
Why sudo Is Safer Than Root Login
Using sudo avoids logging in as root, reduces accidental damage, and keeps a log of administrative actions. This improves system security and accountability.
